DataElement.preferredName: Medical History Orthopedic Or Surgical Procedure Name
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the name of surgery broadly concerned with the skeletal system (bones and joints).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Medical History Orthopedic Or Surgical Procedure
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Medical; relating to the study or practice of medicine._The aggregate of past events; the continuum of events occurring in succession leading from the past to the present; a record or narrative description of past events._Orthopedics is the branch of surgery broadly concerned with the skeletal system (bones and joints). (from On-line Medical Dictionary)_An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Medical; relating to the study or practice of medicine.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the study or practice of medicine.

Property.preferredDefinition: The aggregate of past events; the continuum of events occurring in succession leading from the past to the present; a record or narrative description of past events.:Orthopedics is the branch of surgery broadly concerned with the skeletal system (bones and joints). (from On-line Medical Dictionary):An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Concepts.definition: The aggregate of past events; the continuum of events occurring in succession leading from the past to the present; a record or narrative description of past events.
The branch of surgery broadly concerned with the skeletal system (bones and joints).

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.

A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The words or language units of surgery broadly concerned with the skeletal system (bones and joints).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: No Value Exists: Connective tissue that forms the skeletal components of the body.: Healthy skin, bone, or other tissue taken from one part of the body and used to replace diseased or injured tissue removed from another part of the body.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
No Value Exists
The structural organ comprised of specialized connective tissue that forms the skeletal components of the body.
Tissue or organ transplanted from a donor to a recipient.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Bone grafts that have their own blood supply.

Concepts.definition: Bone grafts that have their own blood supply.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.: Surgical reconstruction or replacement of all or part of a malformed, diseased, degenerated, or otherwise damaged joint.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.
Surgical reconstruction or replacement of all or part of a malformed, diseased, degenerated, or otherwise damaged joint.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The trimming and capping of the joint head with ceramic, metal or plastic components and the removal of damaged bone and cartilage within the socket and replacement with a metal shell.

Concepts.definition: The trimming and capping of the joint head with ceramic, metal or plastic components and the removal of damaged bone and cartilage within the socket and replacement with a metal shell.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical cutting or removal of bone.

Concepts.definition: Surgical cutting or removal of bone.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An outpatient procedure to repair damaged cartilage in the knee.

Concepts.definition: An outpatient procedure to repair damaged cartilage in the knee.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.: Be specific about something; define clearly.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
Be specific about something; define clearly.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The center of an object; indispensable: Decompression external to the body, most often the slow lessening of external pressure on the whole body (especially in caisson workers, deep sea divers, and persons who ascend to great heights) to prevent DECOMPRESSION SICKNESS. It includes also sudden accidental decompression, but not surgical (local) decompression or decompression applied through body openings.

Concepts.definition: The center of an object; indispensable

Decompression external to the body, most often the slow lessening of external pressure on the whole body (especially in caisson workers, deep sea divers, and persons who ascend to great heights) to prevent DECOMPRESSION SICKNESS. It includes also sudden accidental decompression, but not surgical (local) decompression or decompression applied through body openings.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or not been completed.

Concepts.definition: Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or not been completed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

Concepts.definition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.
